text:
M. S. Novik^
June 23, 19$k
Dear Dicks
It was good to get yours of June 17th. I m glad
that the decks have been cleared and that the
people are at work on the transmitter installation,
the sooner you are able to go on the air, the better.
I hope the co«oaumty is aware of the week to week
progress you are making. X can’t help but feel the
next six months will be crucial. The pressure for
FCC will be great. The high rate of the few stations
that have changed hands will make a lot of guys put
up a fight for the few regaining channels, and the
reserve educational frequencies are the easiest
target.
So, lots of luck to you and it was good to have
been of s orae help.
MSN/W
Mr. Richard J. Goggin
General Manager
Station KETC
St. Louis $, Missouri
